application.name: lopdsgen
application.brief: Convert from Isis 3 Lunar Orbiter cubes to the PDS format
application.description: Program to convert Isis 3 cubes for Lunar Orbiter strips and level 1 products to PDS image files.

history.change: Updated test and example for changes to PVL.
Added support for reexporting the cubes generated from PDS files produced by this application.

parameter.name: FROM
parameter.description: The LO strip or level 1 Isis 3 cube to be converted to PDS format.

parameter.name: BITTYPE
parameter.description: Bit type of output: 8 bit (0=black, 255=white) 16 bit unsigned (0=black, 65535=white) 16 bit signed (-32767=black, 32768=white) 32 bit (1.17549435e-38=black, 3.40282347e+38=white)

option.description: Pixels are in 8-bit data range (0 to 255).
Pixels are in the 16-bit data range (0 to 65535)
Pixels are in 16-bit signed data range (-32768 to 32767)
Pixels are in the 32-bit floating point data range (-3.40282347e+38 to 3.40282347e+38)

parameter.name: NULL
parameter.brief: Dedicates the minimum DN value for null pixels.
parameter.description: If set to true, the minimum value of the raw output data will be reserved for null pixels. The actual value used for null pixels will be denoted in the print.prt file as well as displayed onscreen.

parameter.name: LRS
parameter.brief: Dedicates a DN value for LRS pixels.
parameter.description: If set to true, then an output DN value is set aside for the LRS input pixels. The actual DN value used for LRS pixels will be denoted in the print.prt file as well as displayed onscreen.

parameter.name: LIS
parameter.brief: Dedicates a DN value for LIS pixels.
parameter.description: If set to true, then an output DN value is set aside for the LIS input pixels. The actual DN value used for LIS pixels will be denoted in the print.prt file as well as displayed onscreen.

parameter.name: HIS
parameter.brief: Dedicates a DN value for HIS pixels.
parameter.description: If set to true, then an output DN value is set aside for the HIS input pixels. The actual DN value used for HIS pixels will be denoted in the print.prt file as well as displayed onscreen.

parameter.name: HRS
parameter.brief: Dedicates a DN value for HRS pixels.
parameter.description: If set to true, then an output DN value is set aside for the HRS input pixels. The actual DN value used for HRS pixels will be denoted in the print.prt file as well as displayed onscreen.

parameter.name: STRETCH
parameter.description: This parameter is used to select one of three ways to stretch (or map) the input pixels. They are NONE, LINEAR, or MANUAL.

option.description: A minimum and maximum are automatically computed based on the statistics of the selected input band. A histogram of the band is used to pick the minimum at 0.5% of the data and the maximum at 99.5% of the data. Input pixels less than or equal to the minimum are stretched to black while pixels greater than the or equal to the maximum are stretched to white. A linear mapping occurs between the minimum and maximum.
This option allows you to pick your own stretch. You must enter a value for MINIMUM and MAXIMUM input pixel.

parameter.name: MINIMUM
parameter.description: The minimum input pixel value which will be mapped to black.

parameter.name: MAXIMUM
parameter.description: The maximum input pixel value which will be mapped to white.

parameter.name: MINPERCENT
parameter.description: The percentage of data in the histogram used to compute the minimum pixel value in the stretch.

parameter.name: MAXPERCENT
parameter.description: The percentage of data in the histogram used to compute the maximum pixel value in the stretch.

parameter.name: ENDIAN
parameter.description: This parameter is used to select one whether the output will be streamed starting with the most significant byte (MSB) or starting with the least significant bytes (LSB). The choice should be made by the user depending upon the format read by the system architecture from which they plan to read the raw data.

option.description: The least significant byte will be the first byte output.
The most significant byte will be the first byte output.

parameter.name: NOTE
parameter.brief: Value for the output PDS keyword NOTE
parameter.description: This parameter allows the user to specify the value of the standard PDS keyword NOTE within the output PDS label. This keyword will be located in the Root of the PDS PVL label.

example.description: This example shows a typical conversion of an Isis 3 Lunar Orbiter cube to a PDS format image. The default settings produce 32-bit data with least significant byte first order.

terminalInterface.description: In this example, lopdsgen will convert a cube to a pds format image with all settings left at their defaults.
